docblock.description: Group schema - id: Group ID.
docblock.long-description: - name: Group name. - uri: Group URI on Gitter. - backedBy: Security descriptor. Describes the backing object we get permissions from. - type: [null|'ONE_TO_ONE'|'GH_REPO'|'GH_ORG'|'GH_USER'] - linkPath: Represents how we find the backing object given the type - avatarUrl: Base avatar URL (add s parameter to size)

docblock.description: List groups the current user is in.
docblock.long-description: Parameters: none

docblock.description: List of rooms nested under the specified group.

docblock.description: Messages represent individual chat messages sent to a room. They are a sub-resource of a room.
docblock.long-description: Message schema: - id: ID of the message. - text: Original message in plain-text/markdown. - html: HTML formatted message. - sent: ISO formatted date of the message. - editedAt: ISO formatted date of the message if edited. - fromUser: (User)[user-resource] that sent the message. - unread: Boolean that indicates if the current user has read the message. - readBy: Number of users that have read the message. - urls: List of URLs present in the message. - mentions: List of @Mentions in the message. - issues: List of #Issues referenced in the message. - meta: Metadata. This is currently not used for anything. - v: Version. - gv: Stands for "Gravatar version" and is used for cache busting.

docblock.description: List of messages in a room in historical reversed order

tag.name: param
tag.description: Room id

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional search query

docblock.description: There is also a way to retrieve a single message using its id.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Room id

tag.description: Message id

docblock.description: A Room in Gitter can represent a GitHub Organisation, a GitHub Repository, a Gitter Channel or a One-to-one conversation.
docblock.long-description:
In the case of the Organisations and Repositories, the access control policies are inherited from GitHub.
The following types of room exist: - ORG: A room that represents a GitHub Organisation. - REPO: A room that represents a GitHub Repository. - ONETOONE: A one-to-one chat. - ORG_CHANNEL: A Gitter channel nested under a GitHub Organisation. - REPO_CHANNEL: A Gitter channel nested under a GitHub Repository. - USER_CHANNEL: A Gitter channel nested under a GitHub User.
Room schema: - id: Room ID. - name: Room name. - topic: Room topic. (default: GitHub repo description) - uri: Room URI on Gitter. - oneToOne: Indicates if the room is a one-to-one chat. - users: List of users in the room. - userCount: Count of users in the room. - unreadItems: Number of unread messages for the current user. - mentions: Number of unread mentions for the current user. - lastAccessTime: Last time the current user accessed the room in ISO format. - favourite: Indicates if the room is on of your favourites. - lurk: Indicates if the current user has disabled notifications. - url: Path to the room on gitter. - githubType: Type of the room. - tags: Tags that define the room. - v: Room version.

docblock.description: List rooms the current user is in

tag.name: param
tag.description: Search query

docblock.description: To join a room you'll need to provide a URI for it.
docblock.long-description: Said URI can represent a GitHub Org, a GitHub Repo or a Gitter Channel. - If the room exists and the user has enough permission to access it, it'll be added to the room. - If the room doesn't exist but the supplied URI represents a GitHub Org or GitHub Repo the user is an admin of, the room will be created automatically and the user added.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Required ID of the room you would like to join

tag.name: param
tag.description: Required ID of the user

docblock.description: Join to target room

tag.name: param
tag.description: Required ID of the room you would like to join

docblock.description: To join a room you'll need to provide a URI for it.
docblock.long-description:
Said URI can represent a GitHub Org, a GitHub Repo or a Gitter Channel. - If the room exists and the user has enough permission to access it, it'll be added to the room. - If the room doesn't exist but the supplied URI represents a GitHub Org or GitHub Repo the user
is an admin of, the room will be created automatically and the user added.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Required URI of the room you would like to join

docblock.description: Kick target user from target room

tag.name: param
tag.description: Required ID of the room

tag.name: param
tag.description: Required ID of the user

docblock.description: This can be self-inflicted to leave the the room and remove room from your left menu.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Required ID of the room

tag.name: param
tag.description: Room id

tag.name: param
tag.description: Room topic

tag.name: param
tag.description: Room id

tag.name: param
tag.description: Enable or disable room indexing

tag.description: Room id

tag.name: param
tag.description: Target tags

tag.name: param
tag.description: Target room id

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional query for users search

docblock.long-description: The streaming API allows real-time access to messages fetching.

docblock.description: User schema - id: Gitter User ID.
docblock.long-description: - username: Gitter/GitHub username. - displayName: Gitter/GitHub user real name. - url: Path to the user on Gitter. - avatarUrlSmall: User avatar URI (small). - avatarUrlMedium: User avatar URI (medium).

docblock.description: Returns the current user logged in.
List of Rooms the user is part of.

tag.name: param
tag.description: User id

docblock.description: You can retrieve unread items and mentions using the following endpoint.
There is an additional endpoint nested under rooms that you can use to mark chat messages as read
List of the user's GitHub Organisations and their respective Room if available.
List of the user's GitHub Repositories and their respective Room if available.
docblock.long-description: Note: It'll return private repositories if the current user has granted Gitter privileges to access them.

docblock.description: List of Gitter channels nested under the current user.
